txt.en: 'My eyesight is considered the finest of all our people.'
'You cannot frighten me, Karazgar!'
Talk to Bótuz Frostblood
'If I do not see something, it is not worth seeing!'
'Bah!'
Search for Karazgar with Bótuz and his warriors
'Keep looking. Karazgar will be around here somewhere.'
Remain alert for any treachery by Karazgar
'He is gone!'
DNT - Blah!
DNT - Blah!
DNT - Blah!
'Remain on your guard, my warriors, and keep watch for Karazgar. He will not surprise us as he surprised Vútro.'
Karazgar has asked to speak with you.
DNT - Blah!
DNT - Blah!
DNT - Blah!

'I have taken the measure of these Zhélruka, but you... you are a curiosity to me.'

Even behind his mask, you feel the piercing eyes of Karazgar upon you. The urge to draw your weapon and cease their study rises in your heart, a sensation made more unpleasant by this lingering doubt: does this urge come from you or from the Warrior himself? If Karazgar notices your struggle, he gives no sign of it when next he speaks.

'There is a smell about you, [placeholder], the odour of all your kind. But there is something else, too: the reek of subservience. I know the Master you serve. I have cast off the shackles that once bound me, and now I shall take what is mine. Why should you not do the same?'

'Karazgar speaks nonsense. He is one man, too cowardly to show his face. Without his fell Master he is nothing. Let him come to Skarháld once, twice, thrice, it matters not how often. The Zhélruka will make him regret the visits. Aye, even the Longbeards will oppose him!'
'Let us return to Skarháld. If these words signify anything more than idle boasting we should prepare for Karazgar's attack.'
Bótuz Frostblood and his Zhélruka have crossed Óinsbridge in search of Karazgar.
'Do you lead this band of dwarves?'
'I will allow you to live if you depart in peace.'
Bótuz Frostblood and his Zhélruka have crossed Óinsbridge in search of Karazgar.
'I have an offer for you, Zhélruka.'
'You came from the eastern lands? Return there and live.'
Bótuz Frostblood and his Zhélruka have crossed Óinsbridge in search of Karazgar.
'You would do well to accept it.'
'Come hither, [placeholder].'
'You have never known a creature such as me, Bótuz Frostblood.'
'I know of you and would see you more closely.'
Bótuz Frostblood and his Zhélruka have crossed Óinsbridge in search of Karazgar.
'Consider your words carefully or you will die for them.'
'This is my offer.'
'I claim lordship over the lands north of the great forest.'
'The Lonely Mountain and the Iron Hills are mine.'
'These Grey Mountains belong to me also.'
Bótuz Frostblood has some words for you now that Karazgar has departed.
'I do. My name is Bótuz Frostblood, proud warrior of the Zhélruka!'
'I will accept no offer of yours, Karazgar, unless it be for your surrender!'
Bótuz Frostblood and his warriors have left Skarháld in search of Karazgar, the Weeping Warrior.
'Ha! Listen to this braggart, my warriors!'
'It would take more than one man in a mask to frighten me, Karazgar.'
'Ridiculous.'
'I reject your offer, Karazgar.'
'I reject it and all your claims!'
'Ha! I will give him reason to cry!'
'With this axe of mine I will drive him from the mountains!'
Remain alert for any treachery by Karazgar
'Keep alert, my warriors.'
'Never trust such a villain as Karazgar, that is what I always say.'
Talk to Bótuz Frostblood
'Did you know he hides his face?'
'This is the last time I will ask this, Zhélruka.'
Talk to Karazgar, but remain alert for treachery
'That is quite cowardly.'
'What is this? Karazgar!'
'Abandon these lands to me, or be destroyed.'
'Perhaps when we find him I will make him remove his mask.'
'Come, my warriors.'
'Very well.'
'He must be very foul to look upon.'
'Karazgar slowed the West Wind not far from here.'
'I make to you three promises.'
'I would never wear such a mask.'
'My axe thirsts for Karazgar's blood.'
'Three times will I come to your fortress.'
'Deprive our Zhélruka women of my handsome visage? Never!'
'He thinks he can intimidate us? Ha!'
'Three times will I rain vengeance upon your people.'
'Perhaps he can scare Longbeards, but he knows little of our people!'
'When last I step upon the threshold, no dwarves will remain to oppose me.'
'Think on it, [placeholder].'
'Then I will weep for you.'
'The Zhélruka are fire-forged in the harsh eastern lands.'
'No, Zhélruka?'
'Let him learn that at his peril!'
'You know he is called the Weeping Warrior?'
'Does he think to frighten us with tears?'
'One of you, at least, has eyes with which to see.'
'Now that would be something worth crying over!'
'Any sign of Karazgar, my warriors?'
Instance: The Warrior Found
'Keep looking, for they say he is a cunning one.'
'I doubt he can outsmart us.'
'No amount of stealth can help him remain beneath our notice.'
'I refuse! The North belongs to me and to my people!'
